title: Discussion: should state be immutable by default?
body:
Taking some hard perspective from Redux, should a component's state be immutable by default, or would that be too much overhead for React? 

Side note, and possibly previously addressed topic: Shouldn't `setState()` be immutable by default? I realize there are [immutability helpers](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/update.html), but _man_ that syntax is hard on the eyes. 

Not so much "sugar" as "vinegar". :) I also know there is a [section on Immutability.js](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/advanced-performance.html#immutable-js-to-the-rescue) on the Advanced Performance page, but it doesn't address `setState()` directly.

It's not clear (at least to me) from [the setState() docs](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/component-api.html#setstate) whether React already handles this.
